text: The 2015 Fresno State Bulldogs football team represented California State University, Fresno in the 2015 NCAA Division I FBS football season. The Bulldogs were led by fourth-year head coach Tim DeRuyter and played their home games at Bulldog Stadium. They were members of the Mountain West Conference in the West Division. They finished the season 3–9, 2–6 in Mountain West play to finish in a tie for fourth place in the West Division. ==Schedule== :Schedule Source: ==Game summaries== ===Abilene Christian=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 2–2 | 1963 | ACU, 32–29 |} ===at Ole Miss=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 0–2 | 2011 | MISS, 38–28 |} ===Utah=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 4–6 | 2014 | UTAH, 59–27 |} ===San Jose State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 40–35–3 | 2014 | FRES, 38–24 |} ===at San Diego State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 23–27–4 | 2014 | FRES, 24–13 |} ===Utah State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 17–10–1 | 2013 | FRES, 24–17 |} ===UNLV=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 12–5 | 2014 | UNLV, 30–27 |} ===at Air Force=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 3–4 | 2012 | FRES, 48–15 |} ===Nevada=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 27–18–1 | 2014 | FRES, 40–20 |} ===at Hawaii=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 25–21–1 | 2014 | FRES, 28–21 |} ===at BYU=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 5–4 | 1998 | FRES, 31–21 |} ===Colorado State=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 5–7 | 2012 | FRES, 28–7 |} ==References== Category:Fresno State Bulldogs football seasons Fresno State Fresno State Bulldogs f
